ETYMOLOGY: Of uncertain origin; possibly from Old English 'curs' (noun) and 'cursian' (verb), meaning to imprecate evil upon, or from an unrecorded Celtic source.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: transitive verb: a verb that requires a direct object
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To utter a solemn invocation of evil or misfortune upon a person or thing; to call upon a divine or supernatural power to send harm.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对某人或某物发出郑重的、希望其遭遇不幸或邪恶的诅咒；祈求神圣或超自然力量降祸。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She cursed the day she ever met him, regretting all her past decisions.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她诅咒遇到他的那一天，后悔自己所有的过往决定。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: intransitive verb: a verb that does not require a direct object | transitive verb: a verb that requires a direct object
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To use offensive, blasphemous, or vulgar language; to swear loudly.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 使用冒犯性、亵渎性或粗俗的语言；大声咒骂。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He started to curse loudly when he realized he had locked his keys inside the car.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 当他意识到把钥匙锁在车里时，他开始大声咒骂。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An utterance, wish, or spell intended to invoke supernatural power to inflict harm or punishment on someone or something.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 旨在召唤超自然力量对某人或某物施加伤害或惩罚的言语、愿望或咒语。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The witch placed a powerful curse on the prince, turning him into a frog.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 女巫对王子施加了一个强大的诅咒，把他变成了一只青蛙。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Something that brings or causes great trouble, misfortune, or harm.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 带来或导致巨大麻烦、不幸或伤害的事物。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The ongoing drought proved to be a curse on the farmers, destroying their crops.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 持续的干旱对农民来说是一种祸害，摧毁了他们的庄稼。
